I'm a research chemist, and I need advice. Which of these is the best way to extract ammonium nitrate from a fertilizer containing ammonium fluoride, ammonium nitrate, and ammonium orthophosphate?

choices.text: Add Barium nitrate's solution to the solution of the fertilizer dropwise until the precipitate stops forming. Filter off the precipitate, and evaporate the solvent from the filtrate. Collect the residue.

Add magnesium nitrate's solution to the solution of the fertilizer dropwise until the precipitate stops forming. Filter off the precipitate, and evaporate the solvent from the filtrate. Collect the residue.

Add copper (II) nitrate's solution to the solution of the fertilizer dropwise until the precipitate stops forming. Filter off the precipitate, and evaporate the solvent from the filtrate. Collect the residue.

Add manganese (II) nitrate's solution to the solution of the fertilizer dropwise until the precipitate stops forming. Filter off the precipitate, and evaporate the solvent from the filtrate. Collect the residue.
